column1: bad start. All about discipline from the start. Goes down for an extra and South Africa are off. Already need to pull things back
much much better. Full delivery outside off, de Kock leaves. Not much swing. None actually
excellent line from Amir. On a length around off, no swing but impeccable line. Blocked away
full and straight again, tight line. Defended by de Kock.
nicely played. On a length outside off, just enough room for de Kock to bend his knees and cut through point. Just timing. Third man gets across first
fuller than good length outside off, still not much movement but left alone comfortably.
good finish. On a length again, around off, played back towards his pad.
carved to third man. Short and slightly wide outside off, slashed away on the bounce to third man for a run.
good length down leg, played away quietly towards square leg
finds the gap. Lovely stroke. Full outside off, just punched through extra cover for a couple.
fullish and straight, towards leg. Still no swing. Pushed towards mid-on. Full face of the bat
short and wide, was there for the cut and Amla cuts. But makes no contact. Extra bounce maybe?
lovely hit. Just a tad inconsistent with their lengths, this is overpitched and beautifully driven on the up to cover. Dot.
shortish length down leg, de Kock wants to leave it but it's on the leg stump line. Flicks his thigh pad on the way to the keeper
excellent delivery. Pitching it up, hopefully to try and swing it, but there is none available. De Kock forced to defend
some inward wobble. Good length outside off, swinging back in. If there is some swing, that line is awesome. Swerves back in, hits de Kock's thigh pad.
beautiful this. Fullish, straight, defended towards point.
141 kph, out if he hit. Full on the pads, worked to mid-on for a terribly-judged single. Mid-on picks up cleanly, Shoaib Malik misses the stumps at the non-strikers end. Pakistan's best fielder.
on the pads again, Amla will pick em off day and night. Worked through square leg for a couple
full delivery outside off, no swing. A thick inside edge into an unpleasant area. Tentative
big appeal, high. Full, straight, quick, accurate. Beats de Kock's inside edge, struck on the pad. Going high.
the first boundary of the day. Good length outside off, de Kock cuts, but there isn't the room he wants. Takes the edge and goes through the vacant third slip region. Lovely bowling this
back of a length this time, using that length for the first time today. Defended towards leg with that bottom hand
fullish outside off, defended
another lovely shot. Back of a length outside off, punched to point from the back foot

bouncer over leg stump, rises a long way and forces Sarfraz to jump and parry it with an outstretched right hand after Amla ducks. Wide signalled - side-on replays show it wasn't really necessary for him to duck
shortish outside off, chopped down to third man
back of a length, close to off stump, punched to short extra-cover
fuller now, slanted into the corridor outside off, left alone
another bouncer, down the leg side this time. Amla misses the hook. Sarfraz's attempt to distract the umpire by appealing for caught behind doesn't work. Signalled wide
back of a length on middle and off, nice line, defended right under his eyes, with soft hands. Ball rolls to backward point
full, close to off stump, punched to the left of mid-off
back of a length, angling into middle stump, worked away through midwicket
that terrific line continues. Full, straight, more off and middle than middle and leg. Clipped to square leg.
fullish length on a fourth-stump channel, pushed to cover. 'Very well bowled, beta,' yells Sarfraz. It is pretty good bowling
not a bad ball, but still cut for runs. Shortish outside off, punched through point for three. The point fielder gets across to save one. Slow outfield, plenty of rain, all correlated
slower ball on off, no cut or turn. Nudged to square leg. Just be there for six balls.
short. Bumper. Good line, outside off. The pull would have been a tough shot. De Kock leaves
flicked through midwicket for three, another slower ball on middle and leg. Merrily chipped. Pulled back again because of the slow outfield.
good length, aiming for the top of off. Defended towards extra cover
fullish, straight, on off. Punched back towards the bowler. This is an excellent opening spell from Pakistan's openers
good length and straight, clipped towards backward square leg for a run.
slower offcutter on middle, guided towards point
fuller than a good length outside off, punched away towards cover
smashed away. Back of a length outside off, but Amla converts it into a bad ball by walking across and slapping the ball over square leg for four. Nicely done by Amla
full outside off, full enough to drive and de Kock leans into it. But a thick inside edge takes it down to fine leg

wow, that should not have been one. Good length on off, lovely line, but Amla gets outside the line, angles his bat in a way to bring his wrists into his flick down to fine leg. Not many do that better
straightish, on middle. Worked to wide mid-on for a run
too straight from Junaid. A cry of anguish. It wasn't Amla, who flicks the ball easily through square leg. Knew where the fielder was so didn't hit him
through again, two more. On a length on middle, shovelled off the inside half through square leg for a couple.
a slower delivery, 134 kph, outside off, dabbed to gully.
flat on leg and middle, worked to square leg. Defensive bowling, from around the wicket

that's plumb. Amla doesn't bother reviewing. Amla tries to do what he normally does, walk across and manufacture a single. But Imad is always accurate. Delivers it with the seam rotating parallel to the ground. It pitches, and carries on to strike Amla in front of middle and off. Intentionally not trying to turn it has worked.
full, straight, accurate. Pushed to cover.
full and straight again, giving absolutely nothing away. No turn. Blocked
straight, too straight maybe and du Plessis flicks to backward square to get one
that's width. An unusual offering, he rarely provides width. De Kock, too, taken aback slightly misses a routine cut. Maybe there was extra bounce.
gun straight. No turn. Full outside off, pushed to cover
quick outside off, 87 kph. Faf's bottom hand takes it to long-on for a run.
too straight, too full from Hafeez. Easy delivery for de Kock to clip powerfully in the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Three more
flat 0on off, nudged to midwicket
overpitched on middle, drilled down to long-on where there is a misfield.
driven away comfortably through to long-off. Sarfraz isn't happy with something.
overpitched outside off, badly-timed drive to long-off
slower, pace off the ball, down leg, clipped down to short fine leg
too straight, nudged to short fine leg.
a bit of width, flat outside off, punched to cover where Shehzad misfields. Allows one. Another one. That's one run Pakistan need to make up
quick outside off, blocked towards point
should have done better but that's not an error at least. Full outside off, pushed to mid-off where the fielder is late on the ball. De Kock gets through for one.
flat on off, blocked
quick, and flat. Nice length. Played away into the off side. Dot.

well bowled. Sees de Kock coming and fires it down leg. Flicked to deep square leg, where Fakhar fails to pick up cleanly, enabling a second run. Sarfraz yells. Pakistan confidence dented in the field
nudged towards midwicket
flat on the pads, worked away to deep midwicket. Not one ball has turned

big appeal. No, says the umpire Illingworth. And Pakistan don't review. Full on the pads, de Kock misses a flick and is struck in front of leg. The ball ricochets towards Sarfraz, De Kock was out of his crease. But he is already up in appeal. Sliding down, I presume. All reds on HawkEye, out on review.
flat and straight, pushed to midwicket
flat and quick outside off, slashed though point for one
full and straight, hammered back to the bowler
flat outside off, carved to point
short and wide, a poor delivery. De Kock waits and waits and waits before slashing a cut to extra cover
fullish outside off, sliced to cover off the outside half
punched to long-on from the back foot
lovely. All bottom hand. All about knowing your strengths. De Kock comes down, meets the ball as it pitches and then whacks the ball over midwicket. Knew which gap he wanted to hit from release
shortish on off, shovelled to midwicket
again. Looks to whip to midwicket. It's full so it's not dangerous. Finds midwicket though

absolutely dead in front. Another one lbw. Another one missing a straight ball. Flat on off, de Kock gets low and misses his sweep. Was that the wrong choice of stroke considering how full it was? Was it premeditated? No bat on that, and it's plumb indeed. Easy call for Illingworth
full and straight, defended
overly full, worked to midwicket from the straight line

that's great running. AB did not even look at where the ball had gone, complete trust in Faf's call. Faf said yes, AB said kay. Worked to midwicket. A lesson in running between two equally quick runners

AB's gone first ball. What? Wow. South Africa in tatters. Flat and wide from Imad. It does nothing but go on with the arm. But it was so wide that AB had to reach out for that so much that it skews off the outside half. Straight to point who takes a reverse-cupped catch. Massive wicket. Humongous moment in the game. AB hasn't score much since SA have arrived in England, not by his standards at least.
full and wide outside off, punched to the sweeper cover
flat and quick on off, pushed back to the bowler. Excellent bowling from Imad, not giving away anything.
flat on leg, no turn. Blocked
on the pads, nudged to fine leg
flat and quick on off, punched to long-on with the strength of that bottom hand
quick on leg, a forward defense.
overpitched on off, no turn. Pushed to the bowler, who dives to his right
another big appeal, sliding down. Flat on the pads, Miller misses his flick.
back of a length, just outside off, punched to sweeper cover
length ball, drifting across towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler
ooh, lovely. Again that drift. Slower, pitching fuller on middle stump. Looks to clip it with the non-existent turn, gets a leading edge into the cover region
length ball, quicker on middle stump, whipped to deep square leg
length ball drifting into leg stump, clipped to backward square leg. Miller wants one, and is rightly sent back
nicely bowled. Tossed up slower on off stump, and this time gets a tiny bit of turn away. Wants to defend back towards the bowler, rolls into the covers off the outside half of the bat
full on middle stump, clipped into the on side and Shadab Khan dives to his right from midwicket to intercept
tossed up slow, drifts onto the pads, clipped through backward square leg
back of a length outside off, punched into the covers and Shadab makes another good stop, diving to his left this time from extra-cover
back of a length on middle stump, punched to midwicket
back of a length, a bit of turn in towards leg stump, clipped into the forward square leg region
length ball sliding in towards off stump, defended into the covers
length ball on middle and off, driven to short extra-cover. Hafeez dives right to stop it
back of a length now, tight on off stump, pushed to the left of short extra-cover this time, and they hurry through for one
down the track now, gets right to the pitch of this ball drifting towards middle and off, punched down the ground to long-on
slower now, slides in towards middle stump, defended into the covers
back of a length, skids on with the drift towards middle and leg. Faf is hurried into a defensive jab
a little fuller, clipped to the right of midwicket
a bit of flight and angle in towards middle and leg. Stretches out to lap-sweep into the fine leg region
back of a length outside off, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
length ball on off stump, pushed to the right of short cover
on the pads, clipped away to the left of midwicket
length ball on off stump, defended into the off side
full on middle stump, clipped through square leg
length ball on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
floated up slow on leg stump, shows the full face to push to long-on
quickish length ball on off stump, punched back to the bowler
down the track and Imad shortens his length. Clipped down to long-on
drifts onto the pads, goes back and works it to the left of backward square leg
goes back to a length ball turning in towards off and middle, flicks it away through midwicket
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room to punch through cover point
ooh, good ball. Stays back to a length ball pitching just outside off. Wants to punch through mid-off, ends up getting a thick outside edge to backward point. No turn, a bit of drift away
back of a length on middle stump, punched to midwicket

a bit slower on middle stump, gets a nice stride forward and laps it away over the keeper's left shoulder. Lovely deft use of the hands. Shehzad is at long leg, but he has too much ground to cover to his right. Despairing dive in vain
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on
full on off stump, Faf plays a checked drive to mid-off

bowled him! Stops on Faf a little and he's dragged it on! Back of a length in the corridor, looks to punch through the off side, and only manages a thick inside edge into his stumps. Ball also seemed to stop on him, and the bottom hand took over
full outside off, pushed towards mid-off

length ball angling across towards middle and off, and that's super-risky. Clips to the right of midwicket - not a long way from the fielder, and towards the natural side of Malik - and they run. Throw doesn't miss by much at the non-striker's end
back of a length, a touch too straight, worked away through square leg
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
nice use of the feet as soon as he sees some flight. The line is straight, but he steps away from it nimbly and drives to long-off
back of a length, slides in towards middle stump, flicked into the ground, to short leg
tossed up outside off, defended to short extra-cover
a bit of flight again, this time he drives hard, inside-out. Shadab dives to his left at short extra to stop it
back of a length on off stump, punched to sweeper cover
flighted ball outside off, stretches out and defends to the right of short cover
length ball slanting across towards off stump, defended back down the pitch
back of a length, angling across the left-hander's body. Looks to pull but it's not short enough. Bottom-edges into his pads
full outside off, punches it hard and Hasan stops it in his follow-through
full outside off, gets a stride out to drive to long-off
short on off stump, pulled to deep square leg
excellent bouncer. Skiddy pace, excellent carry, and it zips over the left shoulder of Duminy after he shapes to pull and then decides, wisely, to drop his wrists and leave
tossed up, drifts in towards middle stump. Keeps his front pad carefully out of the way and defends
back of a length on off stump, punched away through point
down the track, and that's nicely done by Miller. Stays leg-side of the ball, gets to the pitch, and uses the inward drift to whip it away over wide long-on
quicker and flatter, angling into middle stump, clipped into the leg side, past short leg
length ball on leg stump, defended to short midwicket
slower now, drops on a nice length on middle and off, comes forward to defend into the covers
short, rising delivery angled across towards off stump. Gets on his toes to ride the bounce and defend into the pitch
back of a length, slanting into the corridor, steps back and across to defend towards backward point
length ball slanting into the corridor, stops on the pitch slightly. Wants to defend into the covers, ends up inside-edging towards mid-on
another deceptively quick bouncer. This one's rising over leg stump, and Miller shapes to hook before deciding at the last moment to stop himself and leave
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-off
length ball outside off, and an excellent over ends with a quiet push to deep point for one
quickish on off stump, defended back to the bowler
shortish outside off, slapped to deep point
back of a length, sliding in towards leg stump. Goes back to punch to midwicket
a bit of flight now, jumps out nimbly to drive to long-on
oh, excellent. Sees him step out and shortens his length. Gets it to drift in towards the batsman, denying room, and he can only defend it back to the bowler
down the track again, long-on is back, and he decides to take him on. Risky shot, and it just about comes off. Hits with the drift, and clears the fielder with a fair degree of comfort
back of a length, angling away from off stump. Hangs back, waits, and dabs it to the left of the diving slip fielder
back of a length close to off stump, shuffles across to whip into the midwicket region
short on off stump, pulled to deep square leg
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover

gone! Beautifully bowled, and Sarfraz persisting with a slip earns Pakistan a wicket. Angled in from around the wicket, into the corridor, and full. Duminy looks to drive into the covers without really moving his feet, and the ball straightens to take his outside edge. Excellent low catch by Babar falling to his right

oh my goodness, what a sensational delivery that is! Like the last one, it's angled in from around the wicket, and like the last one it straightens. This one, though, isn't quite as full as the previous ball - it's on the perfect length, leaving Parnell rooted to the crease - and its initial line is directed towards middle stump, before the movement takes it past the outside edge of the left-hander's defensive bat to crash into off stump. Top of off.
length ball angled across towards off stump, a modest amount of spin in, defended into the on side
back of a length on the pads, tucked to short fine leg

googly, and what a googly that is. Floated up, angled across the batsman, and it dips as he comes forward to play for the legspin, aiming towards midwicket. The ball slides past the outside edge, and Miller, who momentarily lifts his back foot up, plants it back down immediately
back of a length close to off stump, chopped into the point region
length ball just outside off, a bit of turn and some extra bounce. Morris checks his sweep, so the top-edge only carries halfway to deep backward square leg
back of a length on the pads, tucked away to the right of short fine leg
Full, nearly a yorker, angling into off stump, jabbed back to the bowler off the front foot. Throws and hits the stumps at the batsman's end, but he's dragged his back foot back in time
fullish outside off, big stride out to punch into the covers, where the diving Hafeez intercepts. Throws himself to his right and stops it one-handed. This is a transformed fielding side
bouncer outside off, left alone
ooh, good ball. Full, angling into off stump and straightening away. Full enough for Miller to get forward and drive safely to mid-off
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face for the dab behind square and Shadab dives right at backward point to stop it
banged in short, angling into middle and off. Sways away to evade it, and complete Hasan's maiden
tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper cover
full-toss on off stump, shows the full face and drives respectfully to long-off. Yes, a full-toss
googly pitching outside off, a touch short, makes a bit of room to chop to backward point
tossed up on middle and leg, gets his front pad out of the way to defend back to the bowler
flighted and full on off stump, driven inside-out and short extra-cover dives right to stop
ooh, nice googly, just back of a length and nipping back towards off stump. Stays leg-side of the line and stabs to backward point. He's picking them easily enough, Morris
fullish outside off, steps across to whip it through midwicket
ooh, some late inswing. Length ball, tailing in towards off stump, defended into the covers
length ball, a bit of width, slaps firmly but straight to backward point
bouncer in the corridor, left alone
full now, on middle stump, clipped through square leg
goes wide of the crease and angles it in towards off stump, full, driven back firmly, bounces over the bowler but he jumps and stretches his arms out to deflect it towards mid-on
googly, tossed up and pitching outside leg. Looks to sweep, misses it and gets hit either on the arm or high on the pad - can't really tell without a replay
back of a length on leg stump, legbreak, worked through square leg
legbreak on a nice length on off stump, presses forward and blocks into the covers
beauty. Tossed this up slower outside off, and gets it to dip and rip away to beat Morris' attempted cover drive. Didn't get to the pitch at all
fuller and flatter on off stump, whipped to long-on
googly again, flat and turning towards leg stump. Goes back to work it to short fine leg
an accurate yorker to start, quick on off, jammed out.
back of a length on middle, nudged to square leg for one. This is the best SA can do for now.
nicely hit. Fullish and wide outside off, crisply driven to the sweeper cover for a couple.
good length outside off, Miller thought of pulling but bailed out late. Full face of the bat to defend
good length outside off, driven on the up to the sweeper cover. Playing this well for now.
good length delivery outside off, punched to the sweeper cover again. Good batting by these two
overpitched on off, drilled down to long-off
short on off, pulled merrily to deep midwicket. One more
a googly outside off, skewed to point
flat on off, pushed towards cover. Another single. Too easy
another overpitched googly on middle, hammered to long-off
the googly outside off, spins back in, sliced to the sweeper cover for a run. Decent over for SA
overpitched on off, languidly driven to long-off
slightly short outside off, punched to extra cover. Straight to the fielder
slowed up outside off, very wise. Miller gets low and misses his sweep. Some spin there too
flat down leg, off the pad towards silly point. Should be getting bat on that
keeps low. Flat on off, Miller improvises a push to long-on. Still some pretty good batting
flat outside off, pushed to cover. Another dot.
excellent start. Full on off, the ball seaming back in. Blocked back. Nicely played too
good length outside off, more seam movement, coming back in. Defended towards cover
bouncer on off, 137 kph, pulled to fine leg. Good attacking bowling.
back of a length outside off, seaming away. Dabbed to third man for one. Well played
full, tailing back in towards off. Worked away through to square leg for a single.
full and very wide, pushed away past cover with a nicely-timed drive to the sweeper cover for a couple.
flat down leg, worked to square leg for one
slugged away by Morris. Gets low and goes bang. Slogged away over midwicket. Shot!
slow outside off, the legbreak. Defended
flatter trajectory delivery outside off, carved to the sweeper cover
flat and straight, swept to deep backward square leg
the quicker delivery on off, pushed away to long-on
full and straight, hit back to the bowler. Tidy lines. Keep it there
superb shot. Fullish outside off, a bit of seam movement. Hammered through cover for a couple. Lovely
nice change in length. A bouncer down leg, Morris gets underneath that. I can think of a few shots he would have played had SA been better off
good length outside off, pushed to mid-off
slower, straight ball. Morris anticipates something else, backs away and improvises a sliced cut to third man

given! Was that sliding down? Was there some bat? Umpire Illingworth gives it, and Miller reviews. A superb yorker, full and straight. Was there some reverse swing there? Either way, there was no bat on that as Miller fell over his shot, done in by pace and plenty of movement. Missing leg stump says HawkEye, and that decision is overturned. Good review, used judiciously through the innings and SA still in this.
another terrific yorker from Junaid. On middle. Jammed out nicely.

cleaned 'im up this time, but Junaid has overturned. Beautiful and ugly in one ball. Sensational and awful. Big no-ball. Good call  by umpire Ravi. On a length on middle, Morris is beaten by pace, goes through his half-flick and knocks into middle stump. Free hit.
good comeback but has himself to blame not to have a wicket. A yorker on off, pushed tamely to mid-off
definite reverse swing now. Full outside off, swerves back in and goes through Miller's drive. Cut him in half.
fuller than good length outside off, coming back in. Defended to cover.
almost executes the yorker again, full on off, worked to deep midwicket
good end. Length on leg and middle, defended towards cover
bunted to mid-off. Looking for the yorker again, full on off, pushed up to mid-off. On the bounce
nicely hit. Stays low and pulls through midwicket for a couple more. Beautifully played. Staying low for the bouncer and the yorker.
full on off, driven to mid-off. Dot
another yorker. Terrific stuff. Just great. Kept out though. This is sensational cricket. Not easy to play this. Pakistan's execution has been quite exemplary
hit that. Another yorker, on middle. Skewed to point. The only thing taken away with this style is the surprise element.
another yorker outside off, jammed away to mid-off for one.
full and straight, driven to long-on.
a low full toss on off, moving back late. Worked to deep midwicket

and gone. Big wicket. Full delivery on off, Morris wanted to go over mid-off, a good option, but at this level you have to execute almost perfectly. Morris doesn't, the bat handle turns in his hands and he just lobs a drive to long-on off the inside half. What that means is the SA lower order is now exposed to the swinging, reversing ball.
yorker outside off, pushed to mid-off for a run. Vital fifty for Miller, his slowest in ODIs, but it's one of his best.
chipped to mid-on, on the bounce. Full and straight, Rabada is low, waiting for that yorker. Just bunts the full length

there is that yorker on middle, Pushed away to point for a run. Pakistan, led by Junaid, think this has hit Rabada's toe front. And so they review. If it was toe first, it's out. But the toe isn't close to the ball. And so it's an error from Junaid. I hope he thought it actually hit the toe first as opposed to hoping that it had. Could be crucial in a few overs
nicely played. Full and wide outside off, pushed to the sweeper cover.
nice change in length. Goes short outside off, Miller misses an upper cut. Good option from Amir.
fullish delivery on middle and leg, Miller misses it, ricochets down to third man. Was it sliding down? Yes, says Illingworth
another nice run. A fast bowler will know what's coming. Stays low and pushes to mid-off for one
swinging back in, full, straight. Skewed to long-on. Biding their time nicely
a low full toss, looking for the yorker. Pushed to mid-on.
a short delivery outside off, pulled to deep midwicket. Just hanging in there for a while
full and straight, another bunt to long-on
searing yorker again. Just missed. A low full toss, driven to long-on.
good yorker on middle, kept out.
back of a length on middle, pulled to midwicket. Another dot.
a slower yorker on middle, worked to midwicket for one.
full on off, a thick outside edge to third man for one.
good length, straight. Miller plays it by his feet, towards cover, for one. Biding their time nicely.
slower delivery outside off, hammered to the sweeper cover. Nice, languid drive
another terrific yorker, on leg. Somehow, Miller gets bat on that. With that angle, he gets two to deep backward square leg
full outside off, pushed to mid-off. Not much Miller can do right now, but poke, stab and eke away
another nice drive, but just one. At least a run off each ball. Seven off. Rabada finds the sweeper cover
slightly short on off, hammered away to deep midwicket. Picked the length early.
chipped to deep midwicket. Straight to midwicket if one was there. SA inch closer to 200
nicely hit but finds cover. Fuller delivery outside off, pushed to cover
nice running. Full and straight, worked past midwicket for a couple. Long-on cleans up.
a slower short ball outside off, a half-chip-pull to long-on for one. So badly timed, it lands safely.
a low full toss, bunted, just wide of the bowler's right, for a run to mid-off. Always one with the fielder on the edge
short delivery down leg, pulled to fine leg for one. Nice change again
gets hold of that. Rabada backs away, clears his front leg and pulls over midwicket. That's not a slog, knows where the field is and hits the gap. Thinking batting, good cricketer
full down leg, shovelled to deep midwicket for a single.
on the pads, worked to short fine leg for an easy single eventually. Keeping Miller on a tight leash
nicely bowled, worked to deep midwicket. Miller scurries back for two. A misfield by Shadab. That's one run saved by SA with their running
and again. Chipped towards long-on for two more. Hit quite badly, and so the second is a stroll.
there it is. Full, straight and in his arc. Where has it gone? Up and away. Powered over mid-off, use of that bottom hand to get underneath the length. His muscle does the rest
a short, slow bouncer is very high. Miller misses an upper cut. Wide called.
another short, loopy slower ball outside off is carved to the sweeper cover for a single. That's two for the over.
a low full toss on middle, hammered past Miller for a run to long-on. This is good stuff from Rabada, all you can ask for
another slower ball on leg, flicked away to square leg. Just one.
that will do nicely. Good length outside off, Rabada swings, and gets bat on it. A thick outside edge through the slips region for four. The worst type of four to concede

superb catch by Hasan Ali. Full outside off, Rabada wants to go over long-on but can only skew the ball towards a slightly deep cover. Hasan tracks it early, importantly judges it early, gets across to his right, gets underneath it and takes a lovely catch. Made a terribly difficult catch look terribly simple. Asks for some noise from the crowd.
swung away to deep square leg. Denies the run. On a length on leg
a slower ball on middle, Miller misses a swing. Excellent execution of the slower ball, beat Miller with the lack of pace
shortish delivery on middle and leg, pulled away to deep midwicket who fumbles and allows the second. That was clattered, good effort from Shadab to save two there
another dot. Full and straight on off, finds mid-off.
a slower delivery down leg, swung away but finds short fine leg. Another dot. Vital runs missed but the right tactic
finds the gap to finish. Back of a length outside off, slapped away past cover for four. Sensational timing. That;s his first four. Just six off the final over.
full outside off, driven to cover point
fullish, angling in from wide of the crease. It's a teasing line close to off stump but Azhar judges it well and leaves it alone
back of a length, angling into off stump. Gets back and across and blocks to midwicket
ooh, extra bounce in the corridor. Goes back to defend and the ball smacks him on the bottom glove. Does well not to jab too hard at it, keeps it down in the direction of backward point
length ball on off stump, defended back to Rabada
back of a length, angling into leg stump, tucked away to the left of long leg to get Pakistan off the mark
length ball outside off, Fakhar leaves his first ball in ODIs alone
short, wide, and Fakhar is off the mark in style. A gift, and he accepts it, slashing it away over backward point
ooh, that's some steep lift, just outside off stump. Jumps from just short of good length and zips past the gloves as he tries to punch off the back foot
full outside off, nice stride out to push to the right of short cover. Early call, quick single easily completed
back of a length, slanting away from off stump, Azhar leaves
length ball close to off stump, shuffles across and looks to clip into the midwicket region. The angle means he plays it too close to the bowler's follow-through to get a single
in the blockhole on middle and off, blocked back to the bowler
full on off stump, driven to mid-off, who comes in quickly to cut off the single

ouch. Looks for the bouncer, leg-stumpish, too quick for Fakhar. Swivels to hook, and the ball hits his helmet grille before hitting the glove and then the back of his bat. Could have gone to slip had it made better contact
fullish on off stump, pushed towards mid-off for a quick single. AB clutches his thigh after chasing and failing to pick up

shot! length ball on off stump, and that's a super shot. Just shows the full face and punches through the line, beats mid-off easily to his left. AB's hamstrings aren't in the best shape, and he doesn't chase with any real speed or intent
back of a length on leg stump, and Fakhar picks up another excellent quick single. Lets it come on, plays with a straight bat and soft hands to the left of midwicket
short outside off, not too much width but Zaman doesn't mind. Slaps it away at the top of its bounce and sends it racing through point
short, even more width this time, and this is all too easy for the debutant, flays it away and puts it into the gap to the left of backward point
back of a length, closer to off stump. Lets it come on and dabs it to third man
short ball, a bit of nip back in towards the body. Jumps to ride the bounce and tuck it into the leg side. Ball beats his inside edge and hits thigh pad
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and tucks it neatly into the backward square leg region

back of a length outside off, lets it come on and uses his hands well to dab it to the right of backward point. Big mix-up between the batsmen as Fakhar turns back for the second before Azhar sends him back. Throw goes to the keeper's end, and that gives Fakhar just enough time to turn around, run back and dive in by the time the keeper can throw to the bowler's end. Throw misses anyway
full on middle and leg. Gets his front pad out of the way and drives towards mid-on
back of a length on off stump, punched crisply to backward point

wow. I thought he mishit that one. Length ball slanting across to off stump and he clears his front leg and swats it over mid-on. Seemed to hit the outside half of his bat - which turned a little as well - but the ball just flew, and went all the way over wide long-on

back of a length on off stump, not too much wrong with that ball, and he's cleared his front leg to make just a bit of room, and then flowed his bat through it with an open face to drive on the up to the right of cover point. Wow
length ball on off stump, clears his front leg and pushes towards mid-off. AB sprints in, dives, and throws on the dive towards the bowler's end. Is he injured or not?
length ball, fourth-stump line, Azhar presses forward and defends towards cover point
length ball on middle stump, worked away to the left of midwicket
back of a length, fourth-stump line, gets back and across and on his toes to defend into the on side
back of a length on off stump, jumps back and across to defend, with a turn of the wrists, towards mid-on
back of a length, angling into the stumps, clipped away to the right of mid-on
back of a length on off stump, defended to short midwicket
shortish outside off, jumps to get on top of the bounce and squirt a defensive dab into the point region
length ball on leg stump, clipped gently to the left of midwicket

short on off stump, and that's a good, early step back and across across to get into a great position for the short-arm pull to the right of square leg. Rolled his wrists over nicely on top of the bounce
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
length ball outside off, steps forward confidently to push on the up into the covers
back of a length on off stump, defended to short midwicket
length ball on off stump, straightens just a touch. Azhar shows the full face to defend to mid-on
short ball from around the wicket, and he's taken another blow to that helmet. Side of the helmet after he top-edges a hook, and he just stands there and grins it off

superb bowling from Morkel. He's really earned this wicket. Set it up with that bouncer, and now he bowls a slower offcutter, just short of a good length on off stump. Zaman clears his front leg, perhaps looking for the pull, looking for the short ball. Picks the slower one late, only offers a feeble push, and the ball pops off the shoulder of the bat to slip
shortish outside off, punched to the right of third man

and another! Short ball this time, outside off, and Azhar goes for the ramp over the keeper. Middles it well enough, but third man is back - not perhaps the wisest choice of shot, therefore - and Tahir tumbles to his left as he takes the catch
ooh, excellent ball. Another short ball, this one jags back like an offbreak towards Babar's midriff. Manages to bring his bat around to work it around towards long leg
back of a length on off stump, defended into the on side
back of a length outside off, Hafeez offers a non-committal push and the thick edge falls short of slip. Didn't really jab at it, but there wasn't much else right with that shot
length ball, a little wider, left alone
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length, a little closer to off stump, lets it come on and blocks towards cover point
bouncer now, gets through quickly and angles into the batsman. Doesn't give him too much time to duck, and he only manages a half-crouch to evade it
shortish, close to off stump, gets on his toes to block towards backward point
ooh, straightens just a touch in the corridor and bounces steeply off a length. Half-forward to defend, beaten by a fair distance
back of a length, closer to off stump, defended into the point region
bouncer outside off, sinks to his knees and sways his upper body away from the line to leave it alone
slower short ball wide of off. Keeps low and sneaks under Babar's attempted cut
shortish in the corridor, a bit of seam away. Well played by Babar, withdrew his bat from the line to leave it
length ball, nips in late towards off stump. Babar doesn't commit early, lets it come and defends into the off side
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
ooh, loose poke from Hafeez. Short in the corridor and he pokes at it. A bit of away movement beats his outside edge
and again, beaten. This one's a little wider. Goes for the punch away from the body this time, can't connect
back of a length, closer to off stump, punched towards cover point
fuller now, angling into off stump. Stays on the back foot and defends into the off side
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the covers
back of a length outside off. Lets it come on and pushes towards backward point
a run, after 20 successive dots. Back of a length, close to off stump. Waits an instant longer this time and chops it down to third man
a little fuller in the corridor, a bit of nip back in. Hafeez covers his stumps and shoulders arms
length ball outside off, left alone
bouncer over off stump, Hafeez ducks
length ball, angling down leg this time. Gets his front leg in the way of the flick, and the ball hits the outside of his pad and rolls down to fine leg
shortish, a bit of nip back in towards off stump. Hafeez would usually look to pull this - he's a good puller - but he tries a tentative little whip instead and inside-edges into his pad
back of a length, too close to off stump to punch into the covers. Hafeez plays it squarer, down into the ground and bouncing up towards backward point
lucky, but as a batsman you need luck in certain situations. Shortish again, outside off. Punches away from his body and gets a thick edge that flies away wide of slip

shortish, angling into off stump. Chops down on top of the bounce and hits it hard into the ground. The ball bounces over the backward point fielder, who dives left, and third man stops it moving to his right
short, angling down leg, Babar misses the pull. Didn't extend his arms fully
length ball angling into leg stump, clipped to the left of long leg
short, a bit of width, cut away to the right of third man and they scamper through for two
back of a length on off stump, pushed into the point region
short ball outside off, rises steeply to beat Babar's attempted pull. De Kock is at full stretch to prevent four byes
short outside off, a bit of seam in to cramp Babar a little as he looks to cut. Hits the high part of the bat and rolls into the covers
back of a length on middle stump. Babar is squared up, defends into the covers off the outer half of his bat
slower short ball outside off, waits and plays a controlled pull out to deep square leg
length ball, angling down leg. Hafeez misses the flick, rolls to long leg off the outside of his pad
back of a length outside off, gets on his toes to defend towards backward point
fuller now, outside off, not quite driving length. Hafeez leaves it alone
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and guides it to third man
shortish again outside off, steered down to third man
bouncer, quick and angling into the batsman. Looks to hook and it zips past his bat and helmet
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
full on off stump, clipped to midwicket
short outside off, chopped away to deep point
tossed up slow on middle and leg, blocked back to the bowler
full on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length googly, turning into off stump. Goes back and across to tuck it to the left of backward square leg
short outside off, stabbed to backward point
just short of slip. Good length outside off, just enough outswing. Even more surprising because it was cross-seam. Takes the outside edge and lands in front.
good length delivery outside off, Babar pokes at that and is beaten. Cannot be indecisive against these bowlers
fullish outside off, excellent line but length is great too. Seeing if there is enough nibble to get the outside edge. It is more a outside half as this goes down to third man
fullish around off, blocked. Excellent bowling
full outside off, carved towards point
superb over. On a length outside off, offering neither width nor the length they want. Hafeez defends.
flight outside off, driven to cover. Keeps hitting fielders
flat outside off, Babar comes down but Tahir shortens the length and forces Babar to defend
a yorker on off, skewed back to the bowler
quicker. Pushed through. Goes on with the arm. Babar punches to cover
big appeal. Bat hitting ground. Flat and wide outside off, Babar drives but hits ground and not ball. Good non-review
steered to the sweeper cover from the crease
full and straight, driven back to the bowler. Morris picks up with his right hand and throws back. Aggression.
back of a length on leg, Babar nonchalantly chips the ball over midwicket for a couple. Knew the field and lifted it over
good length outside off, guided to third man

gives himself room, it's straight. Definitely premeditated. Full and straight, Hafeez doesn't play the risk-reward game well. Gets away with this, sliced through point. Tahir, from third man, gets across to save one.
good length around off, defended towards point. Good line
four. Excellently hit. Back of a length down leg, Babar pops inside the line and pulls. Because he made that effort to get inside the line, his pull goes fine. Fine enough for four to fine leg.
a googly outside off, goes past the inside edge. Hits the elbow, goes through de Kock for a crucial run
flatter down leg, wide

bat-pad, or pad-bat? It's raining. Flat on off, and it hits the pad. AB reviews. De Kock said there was bat. Two clear botches on Snicko, one on the inside edge. But it looks like pad first. Definitely pad first, as is indicated by UltraEdge. Two reds, and one green. Can you believe it? Going over the stumps. Remember, it was a googly, so more revolutions on the ball and more bounce as a result.
another googly that Babar doesn't pick. Flat on off, awkwardly played away
overpitched on off, driven away past the bowler's left who parries the ball
flat and wide, cut to point
legbreak outside off, carved to the sweeper cover
full and wide from Parnell, crisply driven through cover for a couple. Not a good start.
full and wide outside off, left alone. Good. Use that angle
again. Good length outside off, left alone
again. Angled away outside off, Hafeez gets to his drive late. But beaten by just pure angle, a left-armer's
good length outside off, pushed away towards point. Dot.
and again. Full and wide outside off, goes past Hafeez's outside edge again. Terrific comeback by Parnell
flat outside off, carved to the sweeper cover for one
a googly outside off, hafeez picks this, gets forward and defends
block, block, block, six. As long as you hit that six. Hafeez picks this too, gets down, gets to the pitch and lofts the ball over long-on for six.
flat down leg, going down. Goes past Hafeez's inside edge. Struck on the pad
nicely slowed up outside off, pushed back
flat and quick on leg, a thick outside edge to the sweeper cover. Very tentative both sides
full and wide outside off, hammered away through to the sweeper cover. One more. SA need a wicket
good length on off, pushed away to the bowler's right
full and wide outside off, slapped through to deep extra cover. There is one more
a misfield from Duminy at backward point. good length outside off, sliced to him. He slips over in retrieval.
oh my. That's tripe from Parnell. Short and wide from around the wicket. If you come in with that angle, you should not be giving so much width. Sliced in front of point. That's not a good ball.
better but one ball too late. Good length on off, defended away.
bang on straightaway. Good length on off, a loosener of sorts in terms of pace. Easily defended

goooone! Tahir is ecstatic. He's taken a lovely catch. A nice short delivery, aimed at the badge. Hafeez plays a pull and doesn't bother keeping it down. the room for error reduces drastically when you choose that option. Gets a thick leading edge to fine leg. Tahir runs in a few metres and takes a terrific, pressure low catch. Another start for Hafeez, consumed so many balls and then got out.
back of a length down leg, good option. Wide called but good tactic
good length outside off, 132 kph, defended
a slower ball outside off, defended
superb bouncer. Terrific length. Malik ducks underneath. Can't go off for bad light.

excellent cricket. Magnificent. Back of a length on middle, played down towards midwicket for a quick, tight run. Good response from Babar. AB is quick on it and hits the stumps at the batsman's end. But the run is so well judged that no one could have effected that run-out, if AB couldn't/
back of a length outside off, tapped to point
short and wide. That's rubbish from rabada this time. Malik cuts up and over point. Excellent execution
nicely bowled. Full outside off, a thick outside edge past gully. Races away to Tahir's left at third man, who gets across, fields well and slips into the boundary. Signals four immediately.
fullish outside off, defended
back of a length outside off, carved down to third man for one
full and wide, was there to be driven but has to stretch too much. Goes past. Another dot. Good over for Pakistan
back of a length on off, clipped to square leg
full outside off, hit on the up to cover. Just lands in front.
that's great batting. Short and wide again, Malik gets underneath the bounce intentionally and cuts over point. No intention at any point to keep that down. Quality from the outset
back of a length on leg, clipped down to fine leg for one.
that's his second bad ball of the spell. Back of a length, short and wide outside off. Babar cuts over point for four more. Maybe some fatigue creeping in
better response. Back of a length outside off, bunted into the off side
good length outside off, dabbed to third man for one. 143 kph.
good length outside off, dabbed towards backward point who leaps on the ball to prevent one
fullish and wide outside off, hit to extra cover. But Rabada has overstepped. He did this in the series against England too, and should be learning from that. An awful offense
back of a length on off, shovelled to midwicket.
nicely played. A legcutter outside off, driven languidly to mid-off.
a bouncer on middle and leg, too high. Just the one for the over called
runs. Overpitched from Rabada, full and straight. Babar leans into his delectable on-drive and finds the gap to mid-on's left. Races away.
